text: This transmits revised CCDM 30.4.8, Personnel Administration, Training, and Equal Employment Opportunity; Public Information (Speeches, Publications, and Teaching).

CCDM 30.4.8.3.2 was revised to clarify that speaking, writing and teaching as an unofficial activity constitutes outside employment and that employees should follow the outside employment approval procedures. The revised provision also provides that approved Forms 8175 should be retained in the employee drop file rather than the employee’s official personnel folder.
CCDM 30.4.8.5(2) was revised to clarify when an employee may appropriately be identified as a Counsel employee when speaking, writing or teaching as an unofficial activity.

This section imple- ments Government-wide and Treasury conduct rules, as well as rules set in the Internal Revenue Manual. (

) This section applies to all personnel in the Office of Chief Counsel, and to matters involving the Office of Chief Counsel, the Internal Revenue Service, the Treasury Department. This section does not apply to academic submis- sions for non-publication purposes, such as masters theses, which do not disclose official or confidential information, nor does it apply to recruitment tivities. ) Invitations to speak should not be accepted from other than tax exempt zations. Chief Counsel personnel may not speak at events which appear to sponsored principally for profit making purposes, regardless of whether the sponsor is a taxable business or a tax exempt organization. An invitation to speak to any group should not be accepted where the evident purpose or probable result of the event may be to indicate that the sponsor has a prefer- ential relationship with the Internal Revenue Service or the Office of Chief Counsel; where it might appear that information not available to others is provided to a preferred group; or where it appears that the speaker’s official position with the Office of Chief Counsel is being used primarily to foster a private purpose rather than to promote the objective of informing and educating the public. Exceptions to this policy may on a limited basis be justified when the Service or the Office of Chief Counsel has a particular message to convey to a particular group and a speech is the most efficient method to convey that message. (

) Requests to speak at events sponsored by other Government agencies or members of Congress will be afforded the same consideration as other requests. Each request should be considered on its own merit. (
) Generally, approval to speak, publish, or teach in an official capacity will be given only to employees with expertise in the subject to be discussed, published, or taught. (
) The use of confidential information obtained as a result of the employee’s within the Office will not be authorized. (
) An employee engaged in an unofficial activity will not be authorized to make pre-announcement of Office policy. (
